intro: Awayus, commonly known as the Andean lily, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the genus Alstroemeria, which includes over 100 species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in a range of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. Its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, adapted to the cool, high-altitude environments where it thrives. Awayus is also valued for its resilience and ability to grow in poor soil conditions.
